intro: Cirsium dipsacolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring dark green, lanceolate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, followed by bristly, spiny seed heads. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
